metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8594 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The do_mmu_update function in arch/x86/mm.c in Xen 4.x through 4.4.x does not properly restrict updates to only PV page tables, which allows remote PV guests to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) by leveraging hardware emulation services for HVM guests using Hardware Assisted Paging (HAP).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2

No subscription required
